turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey, I'm looking for some new music. I really enjoy electronic music, particularly stuff with a strong house influence. Can you recommend anything?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Certainly! Based on your preference for house-influenced electronic music, I can recommend a few artists. Have you heard of Disclosure, or maybe Gorgon City? They both have a great blend of house and other electronic elements.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: I know Disclosure, they're good. Gorgon City, not so much. Any other suggestions? Something a little more... obscure, perhaps?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, for more obscure artists in the house genre, you could check out Dusky or Bicep. They're both known for their quality productions and are well-regarded in the scene.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Dusky is great! Bicep... I've heard the name. Are they similar to Dusky, or something different?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Bicep's style is somewhat similar to Dusky, but they also incorporate influences from ambient and techno. Dusky is generally more focused on the darker and more atmospheric side of house, while Bicep often has a more melodic and euphoric sound. Here's an example of their music: [link to a Bicep track]. Do you like it?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hmm, that's interesting, but not quite what I'm looking for. Can you suggest artists who blend house with, say, elements of jazz or funk? I'm finding this harder than I thought!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a bit more challenging, but I can try. While strictly house, try St. Germain. He samples jazz melodies into his house beats. You might also like Jazzanova, but they're a bit more lounge-y. And I'm a little unsure of this one, but maybe Goldfrapp's early work? They have elements of both.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: St. Germain! Perfect. Thanks so much, that's exactly what I was hoping for. I'll check them all out.
